body:
Hello @jeevottamlokurti, thank you for your interest in our work! Please visit our [Custom Training Tutorial](https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3/wiki/Train-Custom-Data) to get started, and see our [Google Colab Notebook](https://colab.research.google.com/drive/1G8T-VFxQkjDe4idzN8F-hbIBqkkkQnxw), [Docker Image](https://hub.docker.com/r/ultralytics/yolov3), and [GCP Quickstart Guide](https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3/wiki/GCP-Quickstart) for example environments. 
  
If this is a bug report, please provide screenshots and **minimum viable code to reproduce your issue**, otherwise we can not help you.

@glenn-jocher 
test_batch0.png
![test_batch0](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/35380879/78465778-7939b680-7717-11ea-9f9e-ed3b1a9b76d6.png)

results.png
![results](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/35380879/78465889-bf434a00-7718-11ea-8fe1-e5df48d163ae.png)


I hope the uploaded image is displayed (PS: new to github)
ya that false boxes drawn on background have highest confidence more than 0.9 
Look at the last row 3 images(no passing 1439.jpg) which is almost black do you think those images are creating this mess?

@jeevottamlokurti without seeing your results.png it's impossible to say. Did you train with the default settings for 300 epochs?

Also this dataset may be more suitable for classification than object detection, since the signs do not need to be located in the image.

@jeevottamlokurti ah well your results.png looks very good. I don't think you're going to get better results than near 1.0 mAP. That means that nearly all of the objects are being detected and classified correctly with almost no false positives.

If you said the FPs have >0.9 conf then you can raise your conf to whatever level you need to, i.e. --conf 0.999
@jeevottamlokurti also you should be sure you are training and validating on different images. mAP 1.0 indicates this may not be the case.
Yes I have 90:10 train validation split i tried with --conf 0.999 most of the traffic signs were not detected
@jeevottamlokurti you have to decide on your own threshold obviously that works best for you.
@jeevottamlokurti if your mAP is near 1, there is no point in going further, the model is performing as good as you can expect.
